items.title: Getting Started
items.text: Welcome to Sigil! This guide will help you install, configure, and run Sigil for the first time.

items.title: Prerequisites
items.text:
Requirements for running Sigil on your system.

  • Go 1.23 or later
  • CGo-enabled environment (required for SQLite)
  • Supported operating systems: Linux, macOS, Windows (with WSL)

items.title: Installation
items.text: How to install Sigil on your system.

items.title: Binary Installation
items.text: Download pre-built binaries from the releases page.

items.title: Building from Source
items.text:
Clone the repository and build using the Task runner:

git clone https://github.com/sigil-dev/sigil.git
cd sigil
task build

items.title: First Run
items.text: Start Sigil for the first time and complete initial configuration.

items.title: Initialize Configuration
items.text:
Generate the default configuration file:

sigil init

items.title: Start the Server
items.text:
Launch Sigil in development mode:

sigil start

items.title: Global Flags
items.text:
Flags available to all commands.

--config string      Config file path (default: ~/.sigil/config.yaml)
--log-level string   Log level: debug, info, warn, error (default: info)
--workspace string   Workspace to operate on (default: "default")

items.title: sigil start
items.text:
Start the Sigil gateway server.

sigil start [flags]

Flags: - --host string - Host to bind to (default: "localhost") - --port int - Port to listen on (default: 8080) - --dev - Enable development mode

items.text:
Manage workspaces.

sigil workspace [command]

Subcommands: - create <name> - Create a new workspace - list - List all workspaces - delete <name> - Delete a workspace - switch <name> - Switch active workspace

items.title: sigil plugin
items.text:

sigil plugin [command]

Subcommands: - list - List installed plugins - install <path> - Install a plugin - remove <name> - Remove a plugin - info <name> - Show plugin information

items.title: Configuration Reference
items.text: Complete configuration file specification.

items.title: File Format
items.text:
Configuration files use YAML format.

Default locations: - Linux: ~/.config/sigil/config.yaml - macOS: ~/Library/Application Support/sigil/config.yaml - Windows: %APPDATA%\sigil\config.yaml

items.title: Server Configuration
items.text:
server:
  host: localhost
  port: 8080
  tls:
    enabled: false
    cert_file: ""
    key_file: ""
  cors:
    allowed_origins: ["*"]
    allowed_methods: ["GET", "POST", "PUT", "DELETE"]

items.title: Database Configuration
items.text:
database:
  type: sqlite
  path: ~/.sigil/data
  sqlite:
    journal_mode: WAL
    synchronous: NORMAL

items.title: Security Configuration
items.text:
security:
  sandbox:
    default_tier: process
    enable_wasm: true
    enable_container: false
  capabilities:
    default_deny: true
    audit_log: true

items.title: Provider Configuration
items.text:
providers:
  - name: anthropic
    type: anthropic
    config:
      api_key_env: ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
      default_model: claude-opus-4.6
      budget:
        daily_limit_usd: 10.0

items.title: Channel Configuration
items.text:
channels:
  - name: telegram
    type: telegram
    config:
      bot_token_env: TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN
      allowed_users: []

items.title: Plugin Configuration
items.text:
plugins:
  search_paths:
    - ~/.sigil/plugins
    - /usr/local/lib/sigil/plugins
  auto_discover: true

items.title: Memory Configuration
items.text:
memory:
  max_context_messages: 100
  summarization:
    enabled: true
    threshold: 50
    model: claude-opus-4.6
  vector:
    enabled: true
    dimensions: 1024

items.title: Error Codes
items.text: Standard error codes and their meanings.

items.title: Client Errors (4xx)
items.text:
• 400 Bad Request - Invalid request parameters
  • 401 Unauthorized - Missing or invalid authentication
  • 403 Forbidden - Insufficient permissions
  • 404 Not Found - Resource not found
  • 429 Too Many Requests - Rate limit exceeded

items.title: Server Errors (5xx)
items.text:
• 500 Internal Server Error - Unexpected server error
  • 502 Bad Gateway - Plugin communication failure
  • 503 Service Unavailable - Server overloaded or starting up
  • 504 Gateway Timeout - Plugin execution timeout

items.title: Isolation Tiers
items.text: Execution environments and their security guarantees.

items.title: Wasm Tier
items.text:
Lightweight, memory-safe plugins with no syscall access.

Use case: Pure-compute tools, data transformation, safe parsing.

Guarantees: - No network access - No file system access - No process spawning - Memory safety enforced by Wazero

items.title: Process Tier
items.text:
OS-level sandboxing with bwrap (Linux) or sandbox-exec (macOS).

Use case: Most plugins, including channels and providers.

Guarantees: - Restricted syscalls - Limited file system access - No privilege escalation - Resource limits (CPU, memory)

items.title: Container Tier
items.text:
Full OCI container isolation for untrusted plugins.

Use case: Untrusted plugins, network-heavy tools, complex dependencies.

Guarantees: - Network isolation - Full file system isolation - Resource quotas - No host access

items.title: Agent Loop Security
items.text: How Sigil validates LLM outputs before execution.

items.title: 7-Step Validation
items.text:
1. Parse LLM output to extract tool calls
  2. Validate tool call structure (JSON schema)
  3. Check tool existence in registry
  4. Verify plugin capabilities for tool
  5. Sanitize tool inputs
  6. Check rate limits and budgets
  7. Dispatch to sandboxed plugin
